Posts.Content: Nov 16, 2018 06:26PM Redleaf wrote: maggie0626, I had my biopsy on Wed and found out yesterday that I have invasive breast cancer. They are still doing pathology so that’s all I know. But I’ve had 35 years to prepare, and thought I was. My mother was diagnosed the 1st time when I was 20 and that’s when I had my first mammogram. My latest mammogram in October revealed a difference from the year before and when I saw the mammogram, I was pretty sure it was cancer. I’m handling it pretty well and I have told people because I need their prayers and support. It is scary but it is not necessarily a death sentence. My mother is a 35 year and 16 year survivor. My best friend is a 5 year survivor. We can do this.
Posts.Title: Just diagnosed and scared Maggie0626 Maggie0626

Posts.Content: Nov 16, 2018 09:05PM Redleaf wrote: I had my core needle biopsy on Nov 15. A biopsy doesn’t mean cancer. It’s another step in diagnosis. Even if it is cancer, it doesn’t mean your life is over. My mother is a 2 time, 35 year survivor. You are strong. You can get through this
Posts.Title: Core Needle Biopsy-Terrified! HeatherJS MaddieBrie1
